result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas D Libner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lucas D Libner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lucas D Libner was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must continue and complete Barron County Drug Court

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
Attorney will supply days credit for DE, JOC will be amended at that time

timeConds.notes: Amended to include 24 hours conditional jail time effective 10-06-15.

records.addlTxt: Case settlement

Defendant Lucas D Libner in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 2, will withhold sentence, probation for a 2 yr period.  Will pay CC.  DE enters a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty, with repeater enhancer dismissed.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Withhold sentence, 2 yrs probations, DE will continue in Barron County Drug Court and complete.  Appeal rights given. State will dismiss count one.  Atty will file days credit with the court and make this part of the JOC.  State will dismiss Count one.

Defendant Lucas D Libner in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Karl Anton Huber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of information, enter plea of NG.  Atty wished to address the issue of bond.  Her client will be going into treatment but current bond may prevent this from happening.  No objection from St to modify bond. Current bond will remain but Bond will become a $2500.00 sign bond when a bed becomes available for his alternative to revocation treatment at the tx facility.  Set for 9-26-JT #1, jury selection at 8:30-in chambers @ 8:00AM.  Final PTC 8-11-@ 1:00PM.
Arraignment on March 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Annette Barna in court for Defendant Lucas D Libner. Prosecuting Atty Karl Huber appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lucas D Libner in court. Court in session 9:32AM. Atty Huber calls case and calls Investigator Kummet as witness. 9:32AM Investigator Riley Kummet sworn in by clerk. Atty Huber direct of Investigator Kummet. Atty Huber has no further questions. Atty Barna cross of Investigator Kummet. Atty Barna has no further questions. 9:47AM Investigator Kummet released from stand. Court finds there is probable cause for the filing of a criminal felony action. Court will bind over. Atty Huber files information. Court will set for 03-04-2014 at 10:00AM. Court adjourned 9:49AM.
